etymologies: late 16th century (denoting the sixth part of a circle): from Latin sextans, sextant- ‘sixth part’, from sextus ‘sixth’

definitions: an instrument with a graduated arc of 60° and a sighting mechanism, used for measuring the angular distances between objects and especially for taking altitudes in navigation.
shortDefinitions: instrument with graduated arc of 60° and sighting mechanism, used for measuring angular distances
